articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jack Queen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Donald Trump became the first U.S. president to be convicted of a crime on Thursday when a New York jury found him guilty of falsifying documents to cover up a payment to silence a porn star ahead of the 2016 election.
articles.title: Jury finds Donald Trump guilty on all 34 counts at hush money trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces have ended combat operations in the Jabalia area of north Gaza after destroying more than 10 kilometres of tunnels during days of intense fighting that included over 200 air strikes, the military said on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli military says combat in part of north Gaza is over

articles.author: Bate Felix, Alexander Winning
articles.description: South African political parties geared up for coalition talks on Friday as the governing African National Congress (ANC) looked set to fall well short of a majority in this week's election, the first time this has happened in 30 years of democracy.
articles.title: South Africa heads for coalition as ANC set for big fall

articles.author: Xinghui Kok, Fanny Potkin, Idrees Ali
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is expected to attend the Shangri-La Dialogue security conference in Singapore this weekend, six sources said, as Ukraine faces a renewed assault two years after Russian forces invaded.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy expected to attend Singapore security summit

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Xinghui Kok
articles.description: The Shangri-La Dialogue summit began on Friday with the U.S. and China defence chiefs holding their first face-to-face meeting in two years and the Philippines' president set to give a speech expected to touch on sensitive South China Sea claims.
articles.title: US-China meeting, Marcos speech in spotlight at security summit

articles.author: Sabine Siebold, Jan Lopatka, Jason Hovet
articles.description: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg on Friday dismissed warnings by Russian President Vladimir Putin that allowing Kyiv to use Western weapons for strikes inside Russian territory might lead to an escalation.
articles.title: NATO chief dismisses Russian warnings after lifting of arms restrictions

articles.author: Jatindra Dash
articles.description: At least 24 people died of suspected heatstroke in India's eastern states of Bihar and Odisha on Thursday, and the heatwave in the region is expected to continue until Saturday, authorities said.
articles.title: At least 24 dead in eastern India as temperatures soar

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: In a recent discussion by the east German district council of Sonneberg about getting refugees into work, Roland Schliewe of the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) said demanding jobs could not be given to North Africans because they had a low IQ.
articles.title: Far right AfD cracks Germany's post-Nazi firewalls with success in the east

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: In its quest to fill the dwindling ranks of its infantry, Ukraine has turned to recruiting prisoners to join the fight against Russia, and more than four thousand have applied so far.
articles.title: Thousands of Ukrainian prisoners apply to join army in return for parole

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The people of Sudan are at "imminent risk of famine", United Nations agencies said on Friday, more than a year into a war between the army and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF).
articles.title: Sudan at 'imminent risk of famine', UN aid chiefs warn
